artist: Frank Lloyd Wright; James A. Miller & Brothers
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
text: It’s a weed holder, not a flower vase—Wright believed in integrating the whole outdoors, even the most modest plants of the prairie, into the home. He used the design in several homes he created in the Midwest, including the octagonal library in his own studio in Oak Park, Illinois, in 1898.
title: Weed holder
